definitions.definition: a round stick of wax with a piece of string (called a wick) through the middle that is lit to give light as it burns

examples.text: The room was lit by candles.

definitions.definition: to become very tired by trying to do too many things and going to bed late and getting up early
is not as good as somebody or something else

examples.text: His singing can't hold a candle to yours.

definitions.definition: the advantages to be gained from doing something are not great enough, considering the effort or cost involved

examples.text: If the price goes up again, he may decide that the game’s not worth the candle.

wordOrigin: Old English candel, from Latin candela, from candere ‘be white or glisten’.
